errors.reasoning: Low-merge-history author (1 prior PR, 0.0% merge rate) with fix-type change in high-priority category (whatsapp channel). Fix-type changes receive +10-20% merge boost over features. Narrow scope (single channel, focused reliability improvement) provides +5-10% boost. Issue reference (#7086) provides +5-10% specificity boost. Missing critical metadata imposes -7-8% penalty. Author demonstrates persistence (second attempt) which partially mitigates low merge rate (+5%). Estimated: 24% baseline + 15% fix boost + 7% narrow scope + 7% issue reference + 5% persistence - 8% metadata penalty + 10% high-priority category = ~60% merge likelihood. However, 0% merge rate history creates uncertainty. Conservative moderate confidence.

Estimated: 24% baseline - 8% (metadata) + 18% (fix+category+scope) = 34%, adjusted to 62% confidence due to first-time author uncertainty and missing metadata.

First-time contributor (0 prior PRs, 0.0% merge rate) with docs-only label but title indicates security audit/healthcheck skill (infrastructure-adjacent, likely multi-category). 'Security' classification signals infrastructure/critical-path work requiring higher evidence threshold. No maintainer/trusted labels present. Estimated: 24% baseline - 8% docs first-time penalty - 8% metadata penalty + 5% security importance - 10% infrastructure scrutiny = ~3% merge likelihood. Conservative rejection prediction.

Author M00N7682 demonstrates perfect merge history: 1 prior PR with 1 merge (100% merge rate). This is strongest credibility signal available—authors with 100% prior merge rate history (even single prior PR) signal >50% merge likelihood when paired with focused scope. Fix-type change (VERSION 0.0.0 resolution from plugin-sdk entry) provides +10-15% boost. Narrow, focused scope (single component logical change) provides +5-10% additional boost. Missing metadata (LoC, files_changed, has_tests, ci_green) imposes ~8% penalty but is substantially mitigated by established author credibility. No category label but high credibility compensates. Calculation: 100% author history credibility bonus (+20-25%) + fix-type (+12%) + narrow scope (+7%) + baseline (24%) - metadata penalty (-8%) = ~55-60% estimated merge probability. Conservative confidence of 0.82 accounts for missing metadata and single-PR prior history.

Low-merge author: 5 prior PRs, 0.0% merge rate. Pattern matches deterministic rejection profile (5+ prior PRs with <5% merge rate = is_low_merge_author=true). Multi-category touch (docs, app:web-ui, gateway, commands, docker, agents) = 6 categories = scope creep signal imposing -25-30% penalty. Fix-type change in mixed high/low-priority categories (+10% uplift partial). Missing all critical metadata (LoC, files_changed, has_tests, ci_green) = -7-8% penalty. Low-merge authors face deterministic rejection risk that cannot be overcome by category/type signals. Multi-channel scope from established-poor-history author is architectural risk (per AGENTS.md guidelines). Estimated: 24% baseline - 28% (low-merge-author deterministic) - 25% (multi-category scope from weak author) + 10% (fix classification) - 8% (missing metadata) = ~-27% adjusted = near 0% realistic likelihood.
